Preparing to smash McConnell's Pawn chain.
Finally, he moves a piece!
Clearing the B1 square for the Rook.
A horrible waste of time. 7 B-K2 followed by O-O and Q-side development was in order.
Intending ...N-B4.
Another time-wasting Pawn move. Now Morphy blasts open a line for his heavy artillery.
If White recaptures with the Pawn...
...which he does...
...Morphy seizes the open file.
Too little, too late. He should have started developing 3-4 moves ago.
Planting the Knight on a powerful outpost.
Momentarily preventing ...N-K6.
Exploiting White's lack of development. If White had played 7 B-K2 and 8 O-O Morphy could not now initiate this sacrificial attack.
Virtually forced.
Driving the Q. If 13 Q-Q1, Morphy has 13 ...N-B7 ch 14 Any QxB regaining the piece and leaving Black two Pawns up and White with a hopeless positional disadvantage.
McConnell plays this move instead.
Now Morphy forces the Q back to Q1.
To guard the QP. But...
White's Q is trapped! McConnell resigns at once.
